introduction.pageTitle: You’ll need to delete your GOV.UK One Login
introduction.heading: You’ll need to delete your GOV.UK One Login
paragraphs: We cannot be sure it’s you trying to sign in.
You’ll need to delete your GOV.UK One Login and will no longer be able to access the services you’ve used with it.
After you delete your GOV.UK One Login, you can create a new one.
But first, we need you to confirm some details.
introduction.exitJourneyLinkText: Go back and try entering a security code again

verifyEmailAddress.pageTitle: Enter the code sent to your email address
verifyEmailAddress.heading: Enter the code sent to your email address
verifyEmailAddress.paragraph1: You need to confirm that this is your email address before you can delete your GOV.UK One Login.
verifyEmailAddress.emailAddress: We have sent an email to {{emailAddress}}
paragraphs2: The email contains a 6 digit security code.
Your email might take a few minutes to arrive. If you do not get an email, check your spam folder.
The code will expire after 15 minutes.
verifyEmailAddress.problemsWithTheCode: We can send the code again if the code is not working or you did not receive it.

confirm.heading: Delete your GOV.UK One Login
paragraphs1: You can now delete your GOV.UK One Login.
You’ll no longer be able to access the services you’ve used with it.
listItems: the record of which services you’ve accessed with GOV.UK One Login and when
paragraphs2: It will not affect government accounts that you do not access with GOV.UK One Login, such as Government Gateway or Universal Credit.
After deleting your GOV.UK One Login, you can create a new one using the same email address.
confirm.cancelButtonLabel: Cancel and try signing in again
confirm.contactLinkText: Contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in a new tab).
